content.summary: This document outlines the procedures for serving legal documents such as process, pleadings, or other papers on non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents. It specifies how service can be made through appointed agents and the role of the Commission's Secretary in forwarding these documents. It also provides definitions for terms like 'managing agent', 'non-resident', and 'principal office and place of business'.

elements.title: Service of process on non-resident entities
elements.statement: A person may serve process, pleadings, or other papers on a non-resident investment adviser, or on a non-resident general partner or non-resident managing agent of an investment adviser by serving any or all of its appointed agents.

terms.reason: The term is a general reference to an individual or entity.

elements.title: Forwarding of documents by the Secretary
elements.statement: The Secretary of the Commission will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

elements.title: Certification of service by the Secretary
elements.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

elements.title: Definition of Managing Agent
elements.statement: Managing agent means any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.

terms.reason: The term is defined within the document as a role or position.

elements.title: Definition of Non-resident
elements.statement: Non-resident means an individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; a corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; and a partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

elements.title: Definition of Principal office and place of business
elements.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document outlines the procedure for proceedings initiated by the filing of an application or by the Commission's own motion under any section of the Act or related rules. It details the publication of notice, submission of facts by interested persons, issuance of orders, and conditions for hearings. It also defines 'application' for the purposes of this rule.

elements.title: Notice of initiation of proceeding
elements.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

terms.reason: The term is a general concept related to legal proceedings.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a key part of the procedure.

The verb phrase describes the potential action of entering an order.
elements.reason: The statement prescribes the procedure for publishing notice and entering orders, which must be followed.

elements.title: Submission of facts and request for hearing
elements.statement: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to any individual or entity with a stake in the proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a participant in the process.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting to discuss the matter.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key part of the legal process described.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject of the legal proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe the issue at hand.

terms.reason: The term refers to the justification for requesting a hearing.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe the rationale behind the request.

terms.reason: The term describes the type of stake the person has in the matter.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to specify the person's involvement.

The verb phrase describes the relevance of the facts.
The verb phrase describes the action of requesting a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the potential action of holding a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the action of stating reasons.
elements.reason: The statement outlines the rights and procedures for interested persons to submit facts and request hearings.

elements.title: Issuance of order
elements.statement: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal directive or decision.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used in the context of legal proceedings.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject of the legal proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe the issue at hand.

terms.reason: The term refers to the duration within which actions must be taken.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to specify a timeframe for actions.

terms.reason: The term refers to the specific regulatory body involved in the process.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a well-known entity in regulatory contexts.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting to discuss the matter.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key part of the legal process described.

The verb phrase describes the reference to a previous section.
The verb phrase describes the action of ordering a hearing.
elements.reason: The statement prescribes the procedure for issuing orders and conditions for hearings.

elements.title: Conditions for ordering a hearing
elements.statement: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.

terms.reason: The term refers to the specific regulatory body involved in the process.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a well-known entity in regulatory contexts.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting to discuss the matter.

terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe the issue at hand.

terms.reason: The term refers to the welfare or well-being of the general public.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to justify the necessity of a hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to safeguarding the interests of investors.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to justify the necessity of a hearing.

elements.reason: The statement outlines the conditions under which a hearing will be ordered, which must be followed.

elements.title: Definition of application
elements.statement: For purposes of this rule, an “application” means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal request for an order.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document defines what constitutes a 'small business' or 'small organization' under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 for the purposes of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. It specifies criteria related to assets under management, total assets, and control relationships to determine if an investment adviser qualifies as a small entity. It also provides definitions for 'control' and 'total assets' in this context.

elements.title: Definition of Small Business or Small Organization
elements.statement: The term small business or small organization for purposes of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 shall mean an investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate.

terms.reason: The term is a general category defined by specific criteria.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term is a general category defined by specific criteria.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term is a specific entity type within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the definition.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body, likely the SEC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as having authority to define rules.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'shall mean' is used to define terms.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of assets.
The verb 'deem' indicates authority to decide.
elements.reason: The statement provides a general definition applicable to entities meeting certain criteria.

elements.title: Assets Under Management Criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate under Section 203A(a)(1)(A) of the Act.

terms.reason: The term is a specific entity type within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body, likely the SEC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as having authority to define rules.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific legal provision.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a reference point for rules.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb 'has' indicates possession of assets.
The verb 'deem' indicates authority to decide.
elements.reason: The statement provides a criterion for classification as a small entity based on assets under management.

elements.title: Total Assets Criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.reason: The term is a specific entity type within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific accounting period.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a time reference for the criterion.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'did not have' indicates a negative condition regarding assets.
elements.reason: The statement provides a criterion for classification as a small entity based on total assets.

elements.title: Control Criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more.

terms.reason: The term is a specific entity type within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to the power to direct management or policies.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'does not control' indicates a lack of control.
The verb phrase 'is not controlled by' indicates a lack of being controlled.
The verb phrase 'is not under' indicates a lack of common control.
elements.reason: The statement provides a criterion for classification as a small entity based on control relationships.

elements.title: Definition of Control
elements.statement: Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.

terms.reason: The term refers to the power to direct management or policies.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the ability to influence or direct.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a key aspect of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to the process of dealing with or controlling things or people.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as an aspect of what can be directed.

terms.reason: The term refers to a course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as an aspect of what can be directed.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or legal entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity whose management or policies can be directed.

terms.reason: The term refers to holding financial instruments that represent ownership.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a means of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to a written or spoken agreement.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a means of control.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb 'means' is used to define the term 'control'.
The verb phrase 'to direct' indicates the action associated with control.
elements.reason: The statement provides a definition of 'control' applicable to the context of the document.

elements.title: Presumption of Control in Corporations
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or legal entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity presumed to have control.

terms.reason: The term refers to a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to the legal right to participate in decision-making processes.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial instruments that give the holder voting rights.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a presumption of control.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of voting rights.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on voting rights in a corporation.

elements.title: Presumption of Control in Partnerships
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or legal entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity presumed to have control.

terms.reason: The term refers to a business organization in which two or more individuals manage and operate the business.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to the entitlement to assets when a partnership is dissolved.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial assets or the financial value of assets.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a presumption of control.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of rights or contributions.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on capital contributions in a partnership.

elements.title: Presumption of Control in Limited Liability Companies
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a limited liability company if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC, has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the LLC, or is an elected manager of the LLC.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or legal entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity presumed to have control.

terms.reason: The term refers to a business structure that offers limited liability to its owners.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to the legal right to participate in decision-making processes.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to the entitlement to assets when an LLC is dissolved.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial assets or the financial value of assets.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual chosen to manage the LLC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a presumption of control.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of rights or contributions.
The verb 'is' indicates a state of being an elected manager.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on voting rights, capital contributions, or management roles in an LLC.

elements.title: Presumption of Control in Trusts
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or legal entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity presumed to have control.

terms.reason: The term refers to a fiduciary relationship in which one party holds legal title to property for the benefit of another.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or organization that holds or manages and invests assets for the benefit of another.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual responsible for managing the trust's assets.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a criterion for presumption of control.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a presumption of control.
The verb 'is' indicates a state of being a trustee or managing agent.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on roles within a trust.

elements.title: Definition of Total Assets
elements.statement: Total assets means the total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.

terms.reason: The term refers to the sum of all assets owned by an entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a financial statement that summarizes an entity's assets, liabilities, and equity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the source of total assets.

terms.reason: The term is a specific entity type within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to companies controlled by a parent company.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the consolidation process for total assets.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb 'means' is used to define the term 'total assets'.
The phrase 'as shown on' indicates the source of the total assets.
elements.reason: The statement provides a definition of 'total assets' applicable to the context of the document.
